<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/09/supreme-court-grants-vance-access-trump-records?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Supreme Court Allows Vance to Read Trump’s Financial Diary
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Documents in a folder with Trump Organization insignia" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjc0L3RydW1wX29yZ19kb2N1bWVudHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Supreme Court <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-tax-records-supreme-court-rules-manhattan-district-attorney-access/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released a major decision</a> granting Manhattan DA Cyrus Vance access to President Trump’s tax returns and business records. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In a 7–2 decision, the Robetrotters said the president has the same duty as everyone else to produce evidence when subpoenaed (subpoena = order for participation in a legal proceeding). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Despite giving Vance the go-ahead, the court smacked down an effort by House Democrats to access those documents. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What Trump will (probably) have to turn over </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the subpoena, Vance asked for Trump’s tax returns and business records stretching back to 2011 from Mazars USA, Trump’s accounting firm. We don’t know exactly what kind of misdeeds Vance is sniffing for, but we know he’s investigating hush-money payments made to former adult film actress Stormy Daniels and one other woman. Those payments were made right before the 2016 election. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Trump’s former personal lawyer Michael Cohen has already been convicted of breaking federal campaign finance laws for making those payments. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But Vance can only bring charges under </span><span><em>state</em></span><span> law. Legal eagles </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-09/trump-taxes-likely-going-to-manhattan-d-a-but-maybe-few-others?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a></span><span> that he’s probably investigating whether Trump’s business, the Trump Organization, falsified records when Cohen was reimbursed for the payments. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Falsifying business records can be a felony in New York, but only if it’s done to conceal illegal activity like tax fraud. If the Trump Organization paid Cohen and took tax deductions on that payment, it would have effectively gotten a tax break for paying hush money, which is what legal experts call wrong.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response, Trump tweeted that the investigations were “all a political prosecution.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happens next </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The case still has to be reviewed by lower courts, and the documents won’t be made public anytime soon. They’re part of a grand jury proceeding, which is what legal experts call top-secret. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Vance may get to peek at Trump’s transactions, but it’s <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/09/politics/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-returns/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost certain</a> the general electorate won’t before the November election.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/09/ant-group-coinbase-palantir-ready-ipo-plans-per-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tech IPOs Emerge From Quarantine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bull with crypto " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjcxL2J1bGxfd2l0aF9jcnlwdG8ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">COVID-19 threw markets a curveball, but 2020 may yet meet some big IPO expectations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Alibaba’s fintech arm Ant Group is planning a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ant-financial-ipo-exclusive/exclusive-alibabas-ant-plans-hong-kong-ipo-targets-valuation-over-200-billion-sources-say-idUSKBN2491JU?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosprorata&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hong Kong IPO</a> this year that could value it at $200+ billion, Reuters reports. As the world’s most valuable tech unicorn, it’ll be one of 2020’s biggest debuts. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. In the U.S., crypto exchange Coinbase is looking to go public in a <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-coinbase-ipo-exclusive/exclusive-crypto-exchange-coinbase-readies-landmark-stock-market-listing-sources-say-idUSKBN24A21W?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">direct listing</a>, again per Reuters. With more than 35 million users and a 2018 valuation of $8 billion, Coinbase is the U.S.’ biggest exchange...but still needs SEC blessing before putting an opening bell ring on it. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Coinbase has recently wriggled into mainstream finance: In February, Visa made Coinbase its first pure-play crypto </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/21/coinbase-becomes-visa-principal-member?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">principal member</a></span><span>. And in May, JPMorgan </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/05/13/jpmorgan-extends-banking-services-coinbase-gemini?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">took it on</a></span><span> as a client.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Palantir Technologies said on Monday it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/06/secretive-data-startup-palantir-has-confidentially-filed-for-an-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confidentially filed</a> paperwork to go public, which is the only way we’d expect Peter Thiel’s secretive big data company to do so. It boasts an estimated $26 billion valuation, but its data-mining practices and government contracts (particularly with immigration authorities) have elicited controversy in recent years. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
2020
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/09/joe-biden-releases-first-part-economic-agenda?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
PPP, Meet BBB
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Joe Biden" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjcyL2pvZV9iaWRlbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gage Skidmore</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, presumptive Democratic nominee Joe Biden <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/07/09/889347429/biden-counters-trumps-america-first-with-build-back-better-economic-plan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> the first part of his economic plan, Build Back Better. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What it’s packing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Modernization: </strong>$300 billion in R&D for advanced tech industries such as batteries, electric vehicles, AI, and 5G. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Buy American:</strong> $400 billion in government spending on U.S. goods and services. Biden wants to reduce dependence on foreign economies, particularly in America’s medical supply chain. Those "procurement investments" would also focus on supporting <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/biden-unveils-1st-portion-build-back-economic-plan/story?id=71681986&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">small businesses</a>, particularly minority- and women-owned ones.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden claims his plan will create 5 million jobs. Both he and President Trump are appealing to working-class voters with platforms grounded on reinvesting in American manufacturing and innovation.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If you’re wondering where $700 billion is coming from, Biden plans to raise $4 trillion by reversing Trump’s tax cuts on corporations and the wealthy, and then some. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>before the Democratic convention in August, Biden will detail the remaining three pillars of his <a href="https://joebiden.com/build-back-better/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">economic agenda</a>: modernizing infrastructure, addressing racial inequality, and workforce development.</p>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Don't know you" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l3fZGx5wFR69rNGuc/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok parent ByteDance is considering an extreme makeover of the app’s corporate structure to give it some breathing room from the Chinese government. That may include creating a new management board or moving the HQ out of China, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tiktok-considers-changes-to-distance-app-from-chinese-roots-11594300718?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the WSJ reports</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">TikTok is a global phenomenon. </strong>In Q1, it set the record for most quarterly downloads of any app ever. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But, as many of us can relate, it’s constantly being embarrassed by its parents. ByteDance is based in Beijing and many governments consider it a potential national security threat. India recently <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/07/01/india-bans-59-apps-including-tiktok-citing-national-security-privacy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">banned TikTok</a> (and 58 other apps) in a geopolitical tit-for-tat move.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok is trying to get ahead of the problem in the U.S. It <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/18/disneys-head-streaming-will-become-tiktok-ceo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hired an American CEO</a>, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/08/tiktok-beefs-up-lobbying-team-as-us-government-scrutiny-intensifies.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beefed up</a> its lobbying team in D.C., and is now considering a revamp of its management. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Both Sec. of State Mike Pompeo and President Trump have floated the idea of banning TikTok this week. That scares millions of teens, but it scares ByteDance even more. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">120 times. From one member of <a href="https://www.quora.com/If-you-write-all-the-integers-from-300-to-400-how-many-times-will-you-write-the-digit-3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quora</a>:</p>
<p class="q-text qu-display--block" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"In the ones place, you will write a three once for every 10 numbers, so for a span of 101 numbers (0–100, 100–200, etc.) you will write it 10 times.</p>
<p class="q-text qu-display--block" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the tens place, you’ll write a three for all of the 30s (30, 31, etc.), so another 10 times.</p>
<p class="q-text qu-display--block" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the hundreds place, you'll write a three for every number up to 399, so another hundred times."</p>
</td>
</tr>

href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/trump-tax-records-supreme-court-rules-manhattan-district-attorney-access/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased a major decision\u003c/a\u003e granting Manhattan DA Cyrus Vance access to President Trump’s tax returns and business records. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a 7–2 decision, the Robetrotters said the president has the same duty as everyone else to produce evidence when subpoenaed (subpoena = order for participation in a legal proceeding). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDespite giving Vance the go-ahead, the court smacked down an effort by House Democrats to access those documents. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat Trump will (probably) have to turn over \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the subpoena, Vance asked for Trump’s tax returns and business records stretching back to 2011 from Mazars USA, Trump’s accounting firm. We don’t know exactly what kind of misdeeds Vance is sniffing for, but we know he’s investigating hush-money payments made to former adult film actress Stormy Daniels and one other woman. Those payments were made right before the 2016 election. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTrump’s former personal lawyer Michael Cohen has already been convicted of breaking federal campaign finance laws for making those payments. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut Vance can only bring charges under \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003estate\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e law. Legal eagles \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-09/trump-taxes-likely-going-to-manhattan-d-a-but-maybe-few-others?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that he’s probably investigating whether Trump’s business, the Trump Organization, falsified records when Cohen was reimbursed for the payments. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFalsifying business records can be a felony in New York, but only if it’s done to conceal illegal activity like tax fraud. If the Trump Organization paid Cohen and took tax deductions on that payment, it would have effectively gotten a tax break for paying hush money, which is what legal experts call wrong.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response, Trump tweeted that the investigations were “all a political prosecution.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happens next \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe case still has to be reviewed by lower courts, and the documents won’t be made public anytime soon. They’re part of a grand jury proceeding, which is what legal experts call top-secret. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eVance may get to peek at Trump’s transactions, but it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/09/politics/supreme-court-donald-trump-tax-returns/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost certain\u003c/a\u003e the general electorate won’t before the November election.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCOVID-19 threw markets a curveball, but 2020 may yet meet some big IPO expectations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. Alibaba’s fintech arm Ant Group is planning a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-ant-financial-ipo-exclusive/exclusive-alibabas-ant-plans-hong-kong-ipo-targets-valuation-over-200-billion-sources-say-idUSKBN2491JU?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosprorata\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHong Kong IPO\u003c/a\u003e this year that could value it at $200+ billion, Reuters reports. As the world’s most valuable tech unicorn, it’ll be one of 2020’s biggest debuts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. In the U.S., crypto exchange Coinbase is looking to go public in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-coinbase-ipo-exclusive/exclusive-crypto-exchange-coinbase-readies-landmark-stock-market-listing-sources-say-idUSKBN24A21W?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirect listing\u003c/a\u003e, again per Reuters. With more than 35 million users and a 2018 valuation of $8 billion, Coinbase is the U.S.’ biggest exchange...but still needs SEC blessing before putting an opening bell ring on it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCoinbase has recently wriggled into mainstream finance: In February, Visa made Coinbase its first pure-play crypto \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/21/coinbase-becomes-visa-principal-member?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprincipal member\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. And in May, JPMorgan \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/05/13/jpmorgan-extends-banking-services-coinbase-gemini?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etook it on\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as a client.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. Palantir Technologies said on Monday it \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/07/06/secretive-data-startup-palantir-has-confidentially-filed-for-an-ipo/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econfidentially filed\u003c/a\u003e paperwork to go public, which is the only way we’d expect Peter Thiel’s secretive big data company to do so. Biden wants to reduce dependence on foreign economies, particularly in America’s medical supply chain. Those \"procurement investments\" would also focus on supporting \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/biden-unveils-1st-portion-build-back-economic-plan/story?id=71681986\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esmall businesses\u003c/a\u003e, particularly minority- and women-owned ones.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden claims his plan will create 5 million jobs. Both he and President Trump are appealing to working-class voters with platforms grounded on reinvesting in American manufacturing and innovation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf you’re wondering where $700 billion is coming from, Biden plans to raise $4 trillion by reversing Trump’s tax cuts on corporations and the wealthy, and then some. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ebefore the Democratic convention in August, Biden will detail the remaining three pillars of his \u003ca href=\"https://joebiden.com/build-back-better/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeconomic agenda\u003c/a\u003e: modernizing infrastructure, addressing racial inequality, and workforce development.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok parent ByteDance is considering an extreme makeover of the app’s corporate structure to give it some breathing room from the Chinese government. That may include creating a new management board or moving the HQ out of China, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tiktok-considers-changes-to-distance-app-from-chinese-roots-11594300718?mod=hp_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe WSJ reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTikTok is a global phenomenon. \u003c/strong\u003eIn Q1, it set the record for most quarterly downloads of any app ever. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut, as many of us can relate, it’s constantly being embarrassed by its parents. ByteDance is based in Beijing and many governments consider it a potential national security threat. India recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/07/01/india-bans-59-apps-including-tiktok-citing-national-security-privacy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebanned TikTok\u003c/a\u003e (and 58 other apps) in a geopolitical tit-for-tat move.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok is trying to get ahead of the problem in the U.S. It \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/18/disneys-head-streaming-will-become-tiktok-ceo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehired an American CEO\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/08/tiktok-beefs-up-lobbying-team-as-us-government-scrutiny-intensifies.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeefed up\u003c/a\u003e its lobbying team in D.C., and is now considering a revamp of its management. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth Sec. of State Mike Pompeo and President Trump have floated the idea of banning TikTok this week. From one member of \u003ca href=\"https://www.quora.com/If-you-write-all-the-integers-from-300-to-400-how-many-times-will-you-write-the-digit-3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQuora\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"q-text qu-display--block\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"In the ones place, you will write a three once for every 10 numbers, so for a span of 101 numbers (0–100, 100–200, etc.) you will write it 10 times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"q-text qu-display--block\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the tens place, you’ll write a three for all of the 30s (30, 31, etc.), so another 10 times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"q-text qu-display--block\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the hundreds place, you'll write a three for every number up to 399, so another hundred times.\"\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003ctable bgcolor=\"#1C7FF2\" border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"text-align: center;
